ratings.comment: There is a relatively very small workload for her class. She speaks rather quickly, but isn't too difficult to understand.

She talks really fast, rarely clarifies in English, easy easy quizes, mostly multiple choice, grades fair on essays, easy to get an A in the class though! Use the book everyday. Very interesting class
I loved going to her class.So far it is my favorite Spanish class I have taken. I really liked her accent.

She was a great professor! The class was only quizzes and 2 essays. If you read the assigned literature, the quizzes are incredibly easy. A little bit tough on essays, but as long as you have a solid thesis you'll have nothing to worry about. Really nice person, get to know her during office hours!

Very passionate about literature. Talks very fast, but you get used to it. Loves people who participate and try, even if they're not the best speakers. Turn in tareas-she won't tell you when to turn things in (things that can get you points), so be on top of that.

She is a great professor but talks very rapidly in spanish and does not always make things clear or bother to explain in english. She is a very hard grader, nearly everyone did bad on the compositions and especially the tests. The class is pretty boring and revolves entirely around the book.

Profesora is a great professor! 325 is a conversation class, which she teaches through film. She is incredibly nice, easy to understand, and loves thought-provoking discussions about society and current events relating to the Spanish-speaking world. An awesome prof!
Great teacher. She can be a hard grader, but if you work hard you will see a good grade. She explains everything well and was very nice. You can understand her and I definitely recommend taking her.

She graded hard on compositions and she made her own tests. She tested us on alot of translation of sentences. She can be intimidating in class with an attitude but she has nice in office hours which I didn't know until I went. Try it out! She was helpful
